limitBreak.tier1: Main Gun Base +1 / Main Gun Efficiency +5%
limitBreak.tier2: Secondary Gun Base +2 / Main Gun Efficiency +10%
limitBreak.tier3: Main Gun Base +1 / Main Gun Efficiency +15%

1.name: Ageless Phoenix
1.description: As long as this ship is alive, decreases all enemies' Firepower, Torpedo, and Aviation by 3.0% (9.0%)

2.name: Efficacious Planning
2.description: As long as this ship is alive, reduces burn damage taken by the main fleet by 5.0% (15.0%), and increases their evasion by 4.0% (10.0%)

3.name: Crippling Strike
3.description: 40.0% (70.0%) chance to launch a frontal barrage when firing the main gun (damage scales with skill level). During battle, if fleet contains 4 or more Sakura ships, decreases the loading time of the first main gun salvo by 25.0% (45.0%)

1.chinese: 天城级战列巡洋舰一番舰—天城
1.japanese: 天城型巡洋戦艦一番艦・天城

2.chinese: 天城级战列巡洋舰首舰·天城，原本预定要和妹妹赤城一起接受改造成为航母…可惜我不幸在那场地震中倒下…咳咳…如您所见，我的身体不是很好，不过还请不要有所顾虑
2.chineseTL: First ship of the Amagi-class Battlecruiser, Amagi. I was originally planned for conversion to an aircraft carrier along with my little sister Akagi... Unfortunately, I succumbed to that earthquake... *cough* *cough*... As you can see, this body is not very healthy, but please do not worry.
2.japanese: 天城型巡洋戦艦のネームシップ、天城です。元々は赤城とともに空母に改装される予定でしたけど…あの天災で倒れておりました。げほげほ…はい、見ての通り体があまり丈夫ではありませんが、何卒お気遣いなさらず…
2.japaneseTL: I am the nameship of the Amagi-class, Amagi. I was originally scheduled to be remodelled into a carrier along with Akagi but… I fell in that natural disaster. Cough cough… As you can tell, I am of weak constitution, but please pay it no mind…
2.english: I am the nameship of the Amagi-class battlecruisers, Amagi. Along with Akagi, I was originally supposed to be converted into an aircraft carrier, but that plan was scrapped after a certain natural disaster. *cough* *cough* ... As you can see, my body is not in a great condition, but please do not worry about me too much.

3.chinese: 咳咳...战列巡洋舰、天城，前来拜见。这里似乎能让我稍微发挥一下本领呢...主上，能为在下介绍一下我们的敌人吗？
3.chineseTL: *Cough* *cough*... Battlecruiser, Amagi, here to pay my respects. It appears that this place will allow me to display my abilities a bit... Commander, could you introduce our enemies?
3.japanese: げほげほ…巡洋戦艦天城、参りました。ここなら私も力を発揮できそう…指揮官様、まず私の敵についてご説明をお願いできますか？
3.japaneseTL: Cough cough… Battlecruiser Amagi, at your service. It looks like I'm able to demonstrate my capabilities here… Commander, may I first request to give me explanations on the enemy?
3.english: *cough* *cough* Battlecruiser Amagi, reporting in. It looks like I should be able to fully utilize my abilities here. Commander, would you please brief me on our enemies?

4.chinese: 主上，今日的作战方案已经放在桌上了，请过目
4.chineseTL: Commander, today's combat plans have been placed on your desk, please take a look.
4.japanese: 指揮官様、今日の作戦要綱を机に置いておきました。ご確認ください
4.japaneseTL: Commander, I have left today's battle plans on the table. Please examine it.
4.english: Commander, I've left today's combat operation plans on the table. Please take a look.

5.chinese: 不想让大家受伤吗......呵呵，主上给我出了个难题呢，不过就让我试试吧
5.chineseTL: Don't let anyone get hurt?... Hehe, Commander, that's a challenging order, but let me try it.
5.japanese: みんなを傷つけたくない、ですか……指揮官様も無理難題を仰いますね…ふふ、工夫は致しますわ
5.japaneseTL: You don't want to let anyone be harmed, is it…? I'm afraid you ask the impossible of me… (Giggles), I shall get to work.
5.english: Don't let anyone get injured? Commander, that's quite the tall order, but I'm up for the challenge.

6.chinese: 通往理想的道路虽然艰险，但也因此才有挑战的价值不是吗？
6.chineseTL: Although the road towards our ideals is tough, but due to that, don't you think there is value to the challenges?
6.japanese: 道のりは険しいと言われますが、だからこそ挑戦する価値があると思いますわ
6.japaneseTL: It is said that the path ahead will be arduous, but that's precisely why it's worth challenging.
6.english: The road ahead of us is perilous, but I believe that is also what makes the journey worthwhile.

7.chinese: 无须畏惧失败，主上。有我在，所有挫折和失败都将化为胜利的食粮
7.chineseTL: There is no need to fear failure, Commander. With me here, every setback and failure will turn into fodder for victory.
7.japanese: 指揮官様、失敗を恐れる必要はありませんわ。この天城がいるかぎり、失敗も挫折も次の勝利への糧にして差し上げます
7.japaneseTL: Commander, there is no need to fear failure. As long as I am here, I shall turn all failures and setbacks into fodder for victory.
7.english: Commander, there is no need to fear failure. As long as I am here, all setbacks are but fodder for our victories.

8.chinese: 赤城...成长得稍微有些超乎想像呢
8.chineseTL: Akagi... grew up to be slightly beyond what I imagined.
8.japanese: ああ、赤城…変な育ち方をしちゃいましたね……
8.japaneseTL: Ahh, Akagi… her upbringing has turned out to be weird…
8.english: Akagi turned out... a bit differently from what I expected.

9.chinese: 呵呵呵......啊，主上，我只是在想，点心吃点什么好呢？
9.chineseTL: Hehehe... Ah, Commander, I was just thinking, what shall we have for snacks?
9.japanese: フフフフ…指揮官様、今お菓子は何にするか、思案していたところですわ
9.japaneseTL: Giggles… Commander, I was thinking about what I should make for a snack, you see.
9.english: Ehehe... Oh, Commander, I was just thinking about what snacks I'd like to eat.

10.japanese: んっ…指揮官様…今ほかのことについて思案中だったのですが…
10.japaneseTL: Mh… Commander… I'm afraid I was preoccupied with thinking about something else…
10.english: Oh, Commander... I was contemplating some other things...

12.chinese: 任务报酬...要投入到最合适的地方才行呢...
12.chineseTL: Mission rewards... need to be invested in the most optimal ways...
12.japanese: 任務報酬…一番有効な使い方にしておかないと
12.japaneseTL: Our mission rewards… We must use them in the most efficient way.
12.english: Mission rewards... we should think of the most efficient way to utilize them.

13.chinese: 主上，有信件，是新的情报吗？
13.chineseTL: Commander, you have new mail, is it new intel?
13.japanese: 指揮官様、お手紙があります。新しい情報でしょうか？
13.japaneseTL: Commander, you have received a letter. Could it be new information?
13.english: Commander, you have new mail. Might it be new intel?

14.chinese: 主上，我的计策可有发挥用途？
14.chineseTL: Commander, were my strategic plans of any use?
14.japanese: 指揮官様、私の作戦はお役に立てたのでしょうか？
14.japaneseTL: Were my plans of use to you, Commander?
14.english: Commander, were you able to make use of my strategic plans?

15.chinese: 主上，委托完成了，另外，关于接下来的人选我有些建议——
15.chineseTL: Commander, the commission has been completed. Also, I have some suggestions for the next candidates-
15.japanese: 指揮官様、委託が完了しましたわ。次に出撃する人選について僭越ながらご提案が――
15.japaneseTL: A commission has been completed, Commander. Pardon my insolence, but I have a proposal regarding the unit composition for the next mission.
15.english: Commander, a commission has been completed. Also, I have some suggestions for potential candidates to send on the next-

16.chinese: 感觉身体状况...似乎好了点
16.chineseTL: I feel like my health... seems to have improved a bit
16.japanese: 体の調子がだいぶ良くなってきました
16.japaneseTL: My health has started greatly improving.
16.english: My health... seems to have improved a bit.

17.chinese: 那么，按照计划行事吧，诸位
17.japanese: では、計画通りに参りますわ
17.japaneseTL: Now then, let us proceed just as planned.

18.chinese: 那么...要如何活用这场胜利呢...
18.chineseTL: Now then... how do we make use of this victory
18.japanese: では…この勝利をどう利用するか……
18.japaneseTL: Now… how can I make use of this victory…
18.english: Now then, how can we make further use of this victory?

19.japanese: 計算を…間違えたのでしょうか…

21.chinese: 需要改变一下战术了呢...
21.chineseTL: We need to revise our tactics...
21.japanese: 策を改める必要がありますね……
21.japaneseTL: It seems I must revise my strategy…
21.english: Perhaps a change of plans is in order...

22.chineseTL: A wise commander is hard to find huh...
22.japanese: 伯楽(はくらく)とはなかなか見つかりにくいものですわ
22.japaneseTL: Yokels such as you are quite hard to find these days.
22.english: Swineherds like you are quite hard to find these days.

23.chinese: 对于策士来说最重要的东西就是情报，知道的比对方多，就已经赢了一半
23.chineseTL: To a tactician, the most important is intel, you have already won half the battle if you are more knowledgeable than the opponent.
23.japanese: 策を用いるためには情報が要…「能く上智を以て問者と為し、三軍の恃みて動く所なり」、ということになりましょう
23.japaneseTL: Information is needed to make use of a plan… Let us follow a great man's words: "it is only the wise general who will use spies, because on them depends an army's ability to move."
23.english: Information is a tactician's most valuable asset. Knowing more than your enemy is already half the battle.

24.chinese: 策略只能弥补有限的实力之差，所以...咳咳...让自己变强才是最重要的，主上
24.chineseTL: Tactics can only make up for the difference in strength, so... *cough* *cough*... becoming stronger is the most important, Commander.
24.japanese: 奇を以って勝つといえど、正を以って合わねば戦を制すことなかれ…げほげほ、指揮官様、自ら力を鍛えることこそ肝心ですわ
24.japaneseTL: Indirect methods secure victories, and direct methods cannot command an army… (Cough cough), finding the strength within yourself is essential, Commander.
24.english: Superior tactics can only make up for differences in strength to a limited extent... *cough* *cough* ... That is why becoming stronger is still of paramount importance, Commander.

25.chinese: 咳咳……主上是令天城都心悦诚服之人，再自信一些也无妨呦？
25.chineseTL: *Cough* *cough*... Commander is someone who even managed to earn Amagi's acknowledgment, why not have more confidence in yourself?
25.japanese: げほげほ…指揮官様はこの天城をも認めさせた方ですから、もう少し自信を持ったほうがいいですわ
25.japaneseTL: (Cough cough)… Commander, you should be more confident in yourself, as even I acknowledge your worth.
25.english: *cough* *cough* ... Commander, you've already earned my acknowledgment. Why not have a little more confidence in yourself?

26.chinese: 主上如果真的关心天城，就请全力向前迈进吧……您的胜利与笑容，对我来说就是最好的特效药。
26.chineseTL: If Commander really cares about Amagi, please keep moving forward will all you have got... Your victories and smiles are the most effective medicine for me.
26.japanese: げほげほ…天城のことをご心配なさるのでしたら、全力で前へお進みください…指揮官様の勝利、そして笑顔こそ、 私への特効薬ですわ
26.japaneseTL: (Cough cough)… Should you start worrying about my health, continue ahead and don't look back… Your victories and your smile are my cure.
26.english: Commander, if you truly care about me, *cough* then please keep moving forward with all your might. Your gallant victories and smiling face are the best medicine for me.

27.chinese: 主上……选择了我吗？本想若是为了主公之大业，即便此身殒落也在所不惜……这下看来，不得不稍微注意一下自己的身体了呢……
27.chineseTL: Commander... you have chosen me? I originally thought that as long as I was able to contribute to Commander's ambitions, even if I fell I wouldn't have minded... but it seems like, I now have to take better care of my body.
27.japanese: 指揮官様…この天城をお選びになったのですね？ふふ、元より指揮官様のために身を捧げる覚悟ですが…選んでいただいたからには、自らの健康にも少し気を使った方がいいですわね
27.japaneseTL: Commander… I am the one you've chosen? Aha, I am prepared to devote my entire being to you… but now that I've been chosen, I should better start thinking a little more about my health.
27.english: Commander... so you've chosen me, then? Hehe... From the beginning, I was prepared to lay my life down for your ambitions. But with this being the case, perhaps I should take better care of my body.

29.japanese: 指揮官様の身の回りに、何かいいことでも起きましたか？フフフ...
29.japaneseTL: Did something nice happen to Commander? (Giggles)

30.chinese: 赤城…？哎呀，似乎认错了呢
30.chineseTL: Akagi...? Ah, I got the wrong person.
30.japanese: 赤城…？あら、人違いでしたか…
30.japaneseTL: Akagi…? Pardon, it seems I mistook you for someone else…

31.chinese: 赤城，听好了，是主上的命令哦？
31.chineseTL: Akagi, listen well, this is an order from the Commander, ok?
31.japanese: 赤城、指揮官様のご命令はちゃんと聞くのですよ？
31.japaneseTL: Akagi, make sure you listen to the Commander's orders.
31.english: Akagi, follow the commander's orders, okay?

32.chinese: 咳咳，主上，天城虽善于谋略，对厨艺却是一窍不通，倾尽全力也只能做出这等水平，还请主上不要嫌弃……呵呵，听了这番话，不知道主上品尝巧克力的欲望是否强了一些呢？
32.chineseTL: *Cough* *cough* Commander, although Amagi is a great tactician, I am not knowledgeable in culinary arts. Even with my best efforts I can only achieve this level, I hope Commander doesn't mind... Hehe, after hearing these words, I wonder if Commander still desires to taste this chocolate?
32.japanese: 「げほげほ、私、病体ゆえ調理は不得手でして、全力を尽くしてもこのような品にしかできませんが……」と、こう申せば、指揮官様は私の手作りチョコを一層食べたくなるのではないかと……恐縮です。フフフフ……
32.japaneseTL: "(Cough cough) As I am sickly, I am not good at cooking. Despite my best efforts I can only make something like this..." Well, I'm afraid Commander will be more eager to eat my homemade chocolate after hearing this. Fufufufu...
32.english: "*Cough, cough*... Since I'm so frail, I cannot cook properly, and even with my best efforts I cannot make anything better than this..." Perhaps you will want to try my handmade chocolate even more if I say that... *Giggle*...
